Key Arguments: The legislation infringes on free speech, which is a basic human right.
Determining what constitutes misinformation is subjective and cannot be effectively managed by a government body.
The bill is seen as a means for the government to increase its control over the population.
The legislation is viewed as part of a broader global trend towards authoritarianism.
Notable Quotes: How does a democracy like Australia get to the point of having to pass a bill to do with free speech?
No one has a monopoly on truth.
This is just another ploy for the government to tighten its grip on total power of its people.
